page.title: 03Buildings-Biddestone
page.content: The buildings are very much part of the landscape. Cottages are built of irregular blocks of the local limestone(rubble), with mullioned windows of cut Bath stone (freestone).Roofs are of limestone 'slates' graded in size from eaves to ridge. A few cottages are thatched. Modern houses are built from reconstructed Bath stone in order to blend in with the surroundings. Biddestone Green is most attractive with its houses,large and small, the White Horse pub and the duckpond. Pond Farmhouse has a gazebo, as has Biddestone Manor,a c17 house with attractive gardens at the edge of the village. Hartham Park is another large c18 house in extensive parkland and with a private chapel. (Biddestone Church-next page)
